text: [Music]
job interview skills a program to master
the difficult stages and situations in a
job interview job interview skills
episode 3 preparing for interviews
research the company you applying for
before you appear for an interview you
should know the following a brief
history of the organization its product
service offerings location and branches
recent news about the company key people
in the organization preparation is the
single most important key to success in
a personal interview process begin by
gathering all the information and
documents you may need for the interview
the more you know about the job the
employer and the industry the better you
are prepared you will be able to target
your qualifications and experience to
the specific needs of the organization
that is looking to hire you up to this
point you should have been gathering
some of this information network with
anyone you know who works for the
company or for a related company check
their internet website if they have one
the next step is to match your
qualifications to the requirement of the
job a good approach is to write out your
qualifications along with the job
requirements think about some standard
interview questions and how you might
respond most questions are designed to
find out more about you your
qualifications or to test your reactions
in a given situation if you lack
experience or skills in the required
area think about how you might make up
for those deficiencies some applicants
think that they will be disadvantaged if
they have not received interview
training this is not something to be
concerned about as coached applicants
tend to fall back on
prepared speeches and in contrast seem
uneasy when discussing questions that
are new to them have mock interview with
someone you don't know well this could
be a senior teacher or a lecturer in
your college or school or someone from a
neighboring school or college resume a
packaging resume a or CV that is
curriculum vitae carries the basic
information and all of your history to
begin with the process of compiling your
CV write down everything about yourself
including the associated dates keep a
soft copy of this which you can edit or
amend over a period of time a typical
resume may contains the following data
your career objectives shot medium and
long term a 50-word profile of yourself
companies or institutions or
organizations that you have worked for
and their locations and period all your
job titles for each of your jobs
responsibilities and key functions of
your job achievements anytime you made a
difference on the job education
full-time part-time distance learning
include a table for results and
qualifications training details of all
formal training in-house training and
professional workshops you have attended
interests and extracurricular activities
achievements of the job in your life
outside work you can decide on the
sections and headings professional
progression sounds better than work
experience but this would not be
suitable for a beginner with a series of
small jobs or on a student CV decide on
the general order of the sections and
whether you will place items in
chronological order in case you are a
student or reverse chronological order
if you have a work experience with a
work experience of at least up to two
years most important never use
one-size-fits-all CV your core cv should
always be tailored to the information
required by the organization to which
you are applying and the job profile
should vary based on their needs and
your strengths
now let's understand the dress code for
an interview
although appearance is important but you
want to make sure that you are
remembered for your skills and not for
your clothing it is important to dress
smart and conservative avoid busy patent
eyes and excessive amount of jewelry or
accessories you want the interviewer to
focus on you and not what you are
wearing an article in a magazine spoke
about candidates for job wearing jeans
purple sweat suits and spiky heels or
sneakers other applicants weren't afraid
to show pierced body parts and spiked
hair still others chewed gum or showed
up in rumpled clothes or were their
pants falling down one recruiter even
told a candidate with his trousers down
below his hips to pull your pants up
according to the article the outlandish
dress costs someone the job although
your attire plays a supporting role to
your performance during the interview it
is important in making that first
impression which can be critical factor
in your success
women's interview attire wear solid
color conservative suit coordinated
blouse moderate shoes limited jewelry
neat professional hairstyle sparse
makeup and perfume manicured nails
always carry a portfolio or briefcase
now let's understand men's interview
attire always wear solid color
conservative suit long-sleeved shirt
conservative tie dark socks and
professional shoes very limited jewelry
neat professional hairstyle go easy on
the aftershave neatly trimmed nails in
short look smart wear white or
light-colored shirt avoid loud colors
and flashy ties hair recently cut and
look neat shave in the morning
avoid high heels avoid chunky jewelry
and accessories have a modest makeup and
perfume carry a folder or briefcase
mental and physical readiness aim to
arrive well ahead of time 10 to 15
minutes ahead of schedule time is a good
metric and make sure that you know where
you're going be well rested and arrive
in an alert frame of mind
have a fresh set of formal clothes ready
and be sure to groom yourself well keep
a copy of your application form resume a
and any other material you have
submitted and review it ahead of your
interview ensure you don't say anything
that contradicts what you have stated in
these documents this was a demonstration
video for job interview skills for
complete program visit us at let's talk
company dot in if you like this video
kindly share your comments which will
encourage us to make more videos for you
you can also subscribe to our YouTube
channel by clicking subscribe button
just above this video thank you for
watching us
take care
[Music]
